subject: Parameterized Test Case example
msgSnippet: This is what I mean by a parameterized test case. The feature calculate a person s age by a given date. Each test is a single assertion, but since only the
messageBody:
This is what I mean by a parameterized test case. The feature "calculate
a person's age by a given date." Each test is a single assertion, but
since only the data changes, this test is data-driven, rather than
duplicating the invocation of "getAgeAsOf()" in five tests.

-------------------
package ca.bluejays.scouting.amateur.model.test;

import java.util.Date;

import junit.framework.*;
import XXX.BiographicalReport;
import XXX.PlayerFactory;

import com.diasparsoftware.java.util.DateUtil;

public class CalculateAgeTest extends TestCase {
private int expectedAge;
private Date futureDate;

public CalculateAgeTest(String testName, int expectedAge,
Date futureDate) {

super(testName);
this.expectedAge = expectedAge;
this.futureDate = futureDate;
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Calculate Age");
suite.addTest(new CalculateAgeTest("birthday", 30, DateUtil
.makeDate(2004, 5, 4)));
suite.addTest(new CalculateAgeTest("day before birthday", 29,
DateUtil.makeDate(2004, 5, 3)));
suite.addTest(new CalculateAgeTest("day after birthday", 30,
DateUtil.makeDate(2004, 5, 5)));
suite.addTest(
new CalculateAgeTest("date of birth", 0, DateUtil
.makeDate(1974, 5, 4)));
suite.addTest(
new CalculateAgeTest("invalid future date", 0, DateUtil
.makeDate(1974, 5, 3)));
return suite;
}

protected void runTest() throws Exception {
BiographicalReport biographicalReport = PlayerFactory
.makeBiographicalReport("Joe", "Rainsberger", DateUtil
.makeDate(1974, 5, 4));

assertEquals(new Integer(expectedAge), biographicalReport
.getAgeAsOf(futureDate));
}
}
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
